intro: Columnea silvarum var. butcheri, commonly known as the Butcher's Columnea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks and branches in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually glossy and elongated, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
